required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Using E-Cigarettes on Lungs in People With HIV (HBS Ancillary)
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of E-Cigarettes on the Lung Metabolome in People Living With HIV

collaborator.agency: National Institute of General Medical Sciences (NIGMS)

brief_summary.textblock: This is an ancillary study, thus participants will be recruited from participants in the HBS Study. This project assesses the role of the e-cigarettes and vaping on lung health. The proposed work will inform the design of future studies to better understand vaping's health consequences and to test novel interventions to mitigate vaping's contribution to acute and/or chronic lung injury.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in respiratory tract metabolite profiles in PLWH
primary_outcome.description: Metabolomic analyses of exhaled breath condensate and gas.

study_pop.textblock: People living with HIV (PLWH) in the study site areas who are enrolled in the HBS study (main trial).

criteria.textblock:
This project is an ancillary study to the HBS Study. Inclusion Criteria for that IRB approved study are:
- documented HIV-infection
- in care at an HIV specialty clinic
- age â‰¥ 18 years.
Exclusion criteria for the HBS Study are:
- a pacemaker or other implanted electronic device
- pregnant women, prisoners, cognitively-impaired subjects.
For this ancillary, the experimental group must actively use e-cigarettes or vape. The control group will have no use of e-cigarettes or vape or active smoking in the past year.
Participants must be willing to archive data and biological samples for future use.
Exclusion from the ancillary are:
- active combustible cigarette users
- overt respiratory or oral cavity disease
- acute illness in the past 4 weeks
- active cancer
- active weight loss program
- any other medical, psychiatric or behavioral factors that, in the judgment of the PI may interfere with study participation or ability to follow the protocol

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant Professor, Director Clinical Nutrition and Metabolism Lab
